law.catch_line: Bank not obligated to pay check more than six months old.
law.text: A bank is under no obligation to a customer having a checking account to pay a check, other than a certified check, which is presented more than six (6) months after its date, but it may charge its customer's account for a payment made thereafter in good faith.
law.history: Created 1958 Ky. Acts ch. 77, sec. 4-404, effective July 1, 1960.
